reviewText:
I'd never heard of this movie before, but came across it as an Amazon rental.  I was impressed.  It is fun, has twists and turns in the plot, and will make you laugh.  James Stewart certainly played a different role than usual, but he did a good job at it (of course, I've never seen a movie with him in it that I didn't like).  It's a good, clean, old-fashioned movie with romance, intrigue, and a bit of tension.  Really it's a fun adventure the whole family could enjoy without having to fast-foward or cover your kids' eyes or ears, unlike a lot of movies nowadays.

When James Stewart's character promises to clear a soft-of friend's name by looking for a murderer, he has no idea what he's getting into.  He certainly doesn't want Claudett's character tagging along, but she can't seem to help it--she likes James and she likes the thrill of danger.  She ends up helping him out of a tough spot on more than one occasion, including one moment when he's just stepped off the ferry, thinking he's rid of her and one step closer to finding a clue about the murderer, when the police, who are hot on his trail for hiding their suspect, show up.  Luckily he's disguised in a scout uniform and thick glasses, but they still want to question him about the guy they're chasing.  Claudett shows up at the same time and cleverly spins a tale about her eloping with him, an English actor.  And that's just a taste of the treat you're in for if you watch It's a Wonderful World.  I highly recommend this movie!

It's Jimmy Stewart, what more could a Jimmy Stewart movie lover ask for.  Jimmy Stewart, Claudette Colbert, Cary Grant, Jean Arthur, if you are a fan of any of these actors you'll love this picture.  I love screwball comedies!

When this film was made, Colbert had been around long enough to have had a year as highest paid actress in Hollywood and a year as highest paid performer. She was both a sure-thing box office hit and a highly respected professional. She was versatile: comedy or drama, she could do it all. Steward was acquiring versatility: he had featured with tough guy, Edward G. Robinson, and done comedy (and even a song) in a film with Eleanor Powell. He was fast moving into stardom,
Both show their comedy side in this dizzy dazzler, with Stewart as a private detective, on the way to Sing Sing (although it doesn't say so), who would do anything for a buck (or, as in this case, 100,000 bucks--more than a million in today's coin of the realm). Not to reveal any more than necessary, his path crosses with a daffy poetess, who becomes attached to him. The plot line: how is he to clear himself, while saving his client from THE (electric) CHAIR. Edgar Kennedy and Guy Kibbee are excellent in their patented comedic roles and Nat Pendleton is the epitome of the Dumb Cop. In a brief appearance, the virtuoso of innumerable radio roles (and later a frequent guest on the Jack Paar Show), Hans Conreid, is recognizable.
Most of the comedy is anything but subtle. Physical gags and outrageous mugging are the norm. So, too, are the expert comedic way with lines of both stars.
I wouldn't call this a classic film, if only because it does almost anything for a laugh. I would say that many people will find this 70 some odd year old film a pleasure.

I saw this movie on TCM a long time ago and researched and it was not on DVD yet. I was crushed because I love James Stewart and this movie was great. This past month it showed again on TCM and I looked it up and saw it had been released oh that was a great day! It is a wonderful, fun, enchanting, classic, story that will keep you interested and laughing the whole time with a little bit of mystery surrounding it. I'm not writing out a synopsis, but I will say if you like James Stewart and Claudette Colbert in anything you will love them in this and it is for sure worth the buy and the watch!
This is a fairly unknown title, but with these actors, how can you miss? It's a fun romantic comedy that every Jimmy Stewart fan should see.

This is a neglected, but very, very funny film. James Stewart is on the run from the police, but his troubles have hardly begun compared to when he runs into dizzy dame Claudette Colbert.

The scene in the apple orchard is simply side-splitting, with Colbert proving what a brilliant comedienne she could be.

This film is full of crazy characters, including Edgar Kennedy at his most incompetent. "Screwball" really is the correct word for this one, and it is up there with the very best of them.

I should point out that this is an official DVD-R download from Warner which played with no problems. However, it has to be said that the copy of the film used here is fairly poor with numerous picture faults. A copy from U.K. TV which I saw wasn't any better, so perhaps this is the best that has survived - which is a shame.

Don't let this put you off, because it would be unfortunate to miss seeing this brilliant film. Highly recommended with slight reservations.

It was hard to believe I had never seen this film before.  In fact, I had never even heard of it.  Jimmy Stewart, Claudette Colbert, a script by Ben Hecht?  Leonard Maltin describes it as "very, very funny."  I figured I was in for a real treat.  Unfortunately, it turned out that there were good reasons for this being a rather obscure film -- it's just not very good.  The main problem is the script.  The idea is pretty good:  Stewart plays a private detective who gets arrested while trying to clear a millionaire client of murder.  He escapes and has various adventures with Colbert while on the run.  Unfortunately, it's just not very funny (I don't know what Maltin was thinking).  There is an over reliance on slapstick and physical humor -- Stewart wearing as a disguise glasses that he can't actually see through, his partner repeatedly getting hit on the head, and so on.  Anyone looking for snappy dialog from Ben Hecht won't find it here.  Much as I love Jimmy Stewart, his performances could sometimes edge into the shrill.  That happens a number of times in this one, perhaps because he is trying to use the energy of his delivery to compensate for the weakness of some of the dialog.

If you are a 1930s movie buff, this one is worth seeing, but I give a disappointing 2 1/2 stars.
Good Jimmy Stewart movie!
it skipped! will never buy from again

I know that  "It's a Wonderful World" sounds like a cheap knock-off of the classic "It's a Wonderful Life." Don't let that stop you from watching this gem, because the two films couldn't be more different.

This is funny, fast-paced, and allows Stewart and Colbert to show their acting chops with a comedic flavor. There is great chemistry between these two actors. Jimmy Stewart has a wonderful way of addressing a woman with such genuine sincerity that her heart HAS to melt. Claudette Colbert has a way of thinking fast and sticking by her man that makes you antsy to wish her 'man' would come to his senses.

I listened to several scenes over and over again because the plot does get kind of twisty-turny. It's a good plot. You could say that the cast is multiplied by at least 5 before the final scene gives you the original characcters as they are.
There's a reason this is a classic. The best "What if this never happened? What would your life have been? story ever. A must see.
Cute film.
good movie
Great movie if you like old black and white films made in the 1930-40s.  The acting is great and full of humor.  It is one of my favorite films that I can see over and over again.
Love the classic movies.  Love the classic actors and actresses.  If you missed this one, you'll be glad you finally had the chance to enjoy it!
silly, silly! and too much shouting throughout  the whole movie
i am very happy with this purchase
Nice but the plot is very similar to It Happen One Night.
Very entertaining comedy with Stewart on the run from the law for a crime he didn't commit. Along the way he takes Colbert, a famous poet, as a hostage and the adventure begins.
Adorable, hidden gem
Loved it.
Very Happy with this purchase!!
hard to find a movie that is worth watching.  this one was pretty good.
love this show
It actually was not the movie I was looking for I was looking for Its a wonderful Life but I was not paying attention. Loved this movie though!
Love it!
Good old movie!!!
This story never gets old. Each year at Christmas we always watch it. So much so, it has become a tradition.
A forgotten classic.  Glad to see this finally on DVD!
I thought that this was "It's a Wonderful Life" and wasted my money!.
Best classic Christmas movie!
A YES, because of Claudine Colbert!!!
Such a fun clean movie!

This was so bad I thought maybe Ed Wood had been involved. I just have to believe that when Stewart and Colbert saw it after it came out they must have said: "My god! Did we participate in that crap?"
Love anything with jimmy steward done well
Very good comedy, I will watch it again and again. 2 great stars at their best. Wish they had played more together.
Hilarious comedy! Jimmy Stewart is a riot in the coke bottle thick glasses and Colbert held her own, as usual, and made us believe every fantastic moment. Highly recommended from my point of view.

In reference to the negative reviews of this and so many other old movies: People who don't like the slapstick or outdated themes presented in old black and white movies shouldn't watch them. Most acting in these pictures (of which I own hundreds) is nave and innocent. I know the stories are often contrived and unrealistic.  It's a MOVIE!!! Hello.
Typical Jimmy Stewart movie.  Wholesome and good for the entire family to watch.  Not one of his best but still enjoyable.

This is one of Jimmy Stewart's earlier roles, but he is of course quite good, as is Claudette Colbert.  Very fun movie to watch - was the first time I had seen it.  Snappy dialog (written by one of the writers of 'His Girl Friday') that pushes the (predictable) story along.  If you like the actors, you should enjoy the movie!  Glad to have it in my collection.
While missing all the bells and whistles of a 'modern movie', this one is highly entertaining. Both the principles are terrific. the story line is not entirely predictable. Fun and funny.

I never thought I'd be watching the clock in hopes a Jimmy Stewart or Claudette Colbert movie would end soon--let alone do that when the movie featured both of them--but I was hugely relieved when this clinker was finally over.

The plot was completely unbelievable from start to finish. The dialogue wasn't witty, realistic, or funny. And I've never seen Claudette Colbert be half as shrill, simpering, and downright annoying as she was in this film--everything from batting her eyes to fainting to hysteria.

So, my advice to old movie buffs is to invest your $3 in Sullivan's Travels, My Man Godfrey, or To Be or Not To Be (or No Time for Love, if you're a Claudette Colbert fan). All are far better classic films than this one.
This film is a great old movie. I love Jimmy Stewart films. It's qwerky and romantic and all around a good time.

Even the charm of Stewart & Colbert couldn't save this stinker!  It's a wonderful life is one of my favorites, but don't let this title fool you.  The acting, dialogue and plot were just terrible.  Jimmy has a lot better - check out his westerns if you haven't seen them; Destry rides again is a delight.

It's a Wonderful World is a lovely film much overlooked in favour of it's near namesake. It stars James Stewart (that alone makes it worth watching) but this adds Claudette Colbert as the fly in JS's ointment.  Very funny and touching.

Okay I hate saying this because I love Jimmy Stewart and Claudette Colbert, but unfortunately this is not one of their better films. Personally I think it has nothing to do with either of the actors or their acting abilities. I really think it has to do with the weakness of the script. With the right script these two are amazing. I've seen plenty of their other movies. If you're new to old films this is not a good one to start with. But anyone who adores old films and is an old hand at them go ahead and check this out. Its worth watching for the sake of the actors and their body of work, but not a classic.

it's funny and it's got Jimmy Stewart, but some bits are offensive. Those 1939 values really are pathetic. So, here's Jimmy Stewart, hiding out in a regional theatre production of "What Price Glory," with the characters, during the course of the play, rubbing dirt on their faces to camouflage themselves in war. He's confronted by police officers who are looking for him, and he, there in a kind of "blackface," starts speaking what apparently passed for ebonics in 1939. Someone else mentions going to Harlem and another person says something substantially to the effect that they'll have to put their blackface on. Jimmy Stewart punches Claudette Colbert.  So all that's gruesome, but also there's Claudette Colbert at age 36, looking a bit matronly, and the storyline shamelessly stealing from "It Happened One Night" (but Jimmy Stewart is a DETECTIVE, not a journalist, see?). Still, it's funny, and Jimmy Stewart is just so terrific, in spite of all the screenplay dreck.
Great to see these two actors together. They were fabulous and I enjoyed it a lot.
It's Jimmy Stewart. Usually a good bet the movie is good or better.
Nice movie.  We love Jimmy Stewart movies.
Good movie
A light enjoyable movie to watch.

Such a great old movie.  Jimmy Stewart and Claudette Colbert at their best. Why can't we make great movies with great story lines like this any more?????  So wonderful, you don't need color, sex or gutter talk to get an audience.
Great!

I love the early Jimmy Stewart movies but this one just didn't do it for me. Jimmy was good but I could not stand Claudette Colbert... Wish they'd cast Jean Arthur for the party. Not sure why Colbert became famous ;she's not even pretty... And her teeth were not white....they look gray thru the whole movie.  Anyway, not a favorite.
Wish I'd not wasted my time, not to mention my rental fee. Too goofy, not fun to see jimmy Stewart in this role. I like it happened one night and other screwball comedy, but this wasn't fun.
This was a fun movie with which I had not before been familiar.
